intro: Lychnocephalus grazielae, commonly known as the Grazielae's lantern plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its striking, lantern-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
